name: Lil'Kinz Mini Plush Stuffed Animal Blue Triggerfish
description:
The Blue Trigger Fish is a colorful creature with a bubbly personality. When Trigger Fish aren't searching for sunken treasure you can often find them studying hard at school. This friendly fish makes the perfect pet and is looking for a soggy (yet cozy) place to call home. Special Item: Bubbly Blue Bathtub; Special Food: Coral Cordon Bleu 
Webkinz pets are lovable plush pets that each come with a unique Secret Code. With it, you enter Webkinz World where you care for your virtual pet, answer trivia, earn KinzCash, and play the best kids games on the net! Collect them all!

name: Lil'Kinz Mini Plush Stuffed Animal Pink Glitter Fish
description: Webkinz pets are very special plush animals. Each Webkinz pet comes with a secret code that allows the owner to log into the website and adopt a virtual version of their pet. With this code as their key, children can join Webkinz World without giving out any personal information such as e-mail, last name or phone number.

name: Webkinz Pucker Fish
description:
with activation code for online games and a virtual version of this stuffed animal
•You pick the name of your pet and determine whether it is a boy or a girl
•After adoption, you are shown your pets room and can use your KinzCash to decorate; buy furniture, clothes and food from the W Shop
•Your pet relies on you to take care of it by monitoring the Happy, Health and Hunger meters
•Each pet comes with it's own unique "Special Item" and "Special Food."

name: Assorted Marine Life and Wildlife Book Marks 1
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION CAREFULLY. 

CLICK THROUGH PICTURES TO VIEW EACH ONE.

"Flutterbies"------------(Option 1) 
"Fish Jam"---------------(Option 2) 
"Seahorses"------------(Option 3) 
"Clown School"---------(Option 4) 
"Great White Sharks"--(Option 5) 

Mark your place in your favorite book with these holographic marine life and wildlife bookmarks. The "Flutterbies" bookmark features a group of dazzlingly colorful butterflies, the "Fish Jam" bookmark features a school of colorful tropical fish, the "Seahorses" bookmark features a group of three colorful sea horses. The "Great White Sharks" bookmark features great white sharks. 

CLICK THROUGH THE OPTIONS TO SEE WHICH PICTURE EACH CORRESPONDS TO. 

BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING.

name: Assorted Marine Life and Wildlife Book Marks 2
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION CAREFULLY.

CLICK THROUGH PICTURES TO VIEW EACH ONE.

"Turtle Town" (Option 1)
"Dolphins"      (Option 2) 
"Sea Otters"   (Option 3)
"Jellyfish"        (Option 4)
"Waterworld"  (Option 5)

Mark your place in your favorite book with these holographic marine life and wildlife bookmarks. The "Turtle Town" bookmark features sea turtles swimming over a beautiful coral reef. The "Dolphins" bookmark features a group of dolphins swimming together. The "Sea Otters" bookmark features a group of playful sea otters in their natural habitat. The "Jellyfish" bookmark features a swarm of colorful jellyfish floating gracefully. The "Waterworld" bookmark features sea horses and colorful tropical fish on a coral reef. 

CLICK THROUGH THE OPTIONS TO SEE WHICH PICTURE EACH CORRESPONDS TO. 

BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING.

name: Island Tunes For Kids: Seriously Silly Songs From The Hawaiian Islands! DVD
description: Travel the Hawaiian Islands with Brent Holmes and Hi ilea Aniban as you watch these fun music videos about volcanoes, sea turtles, humpback whales, dolphins and more! With music produced by Emmy nominee Dave Hoffner, this DVD features world renowned musicians and the best children s songs about islands ever recorded! This DVD was partially filmed at the Honolulu Zoo.

name: The Caribbean Island Tunes For Kids
Sharks - Deluxe Box Set (DVD)
description: The TRAVEL*ADVENTURE*NATURE line is an exclusive video series presenting the best from independent producers and filmmakers in 4-DVD box sets. Sharks eat humans. Fact or fiction? Think you know the answer? All is revealed in this sensational DVD collection. Explore the habitats behaviors and physical design of one of the world's most savage and intricate creatures. Be awed chilled to the bone and even reassured all in one collection! Format: DVD MOVIE Genre: MISCELLANEOUS/SPECIAL INTEREST UPC: 781735602171 Manufacturer No: 60217

name: Turtle Teaser (Puzzle)
description: This turtle is looking to give you a real challenge! Jump one peg over another to remove as many pegs as you can, leave just one, and you're a genius! Handy compartment in the bottom stores the pegs- comes with 2 extra pegs.

name: Build your own 3 inch Clownfish Model - 18 piece 3D Puzzle (Age 6+)
description:
•Fun & educational, this 3D puzzle toy has 18 pieces to create a Clownfish Model
•The highly detailed, completed model is approx 3 inches and contains 22 removable parts
•See separate listings to learn about Human Organs & Skeleton, Dinosaurs as well as Animal, Fish & Amphibian anatomy - Cow, Pig, Dog, Horse, Great White Shark, Dolphin, Frog, Beetle, Spider, Crocodile
•Also under separate listings, learn anatomy of a T-Rex, Triceratops, Stegosaurus, Brachiosaurus, Woolly Mammoth and much more
•Presented in full color gift box (5.375 x 1.5 x 4.375 inches); Recommended for Age 6+

name: Build your own 3 inch Lion Fish Model - 15 piece 3D Puzzle (Age 6+)
description:
•Fun & educational, this 3D puzzle toy has 15 pieces to create a Lion Fish Model
•The highly detailed, completed model is approx 3 inches and contains 15 removable parts
•See separate listings to learn about Human Organs & Skeleton, Dinosaurs as well as Animal, Fish & Amphibian anatomy - Cow, Pig, Dog, Horse, Great White Shark, Dolphin, Frog, Beetle, Spider, Crocodile
•Also under separate listings, learn anatomy of a T-Rex, Triceratops, Stegosaurus, Brachiosaurus, Woolly Mammoth and much more
•Presented in full color gift box (5.375 x 1.5 x 4.375 inches); Recommended for Age 6+

•Museum quality with fine detailed sculpturing and hand painted.
•Collect the series great gifts for the future marine biologist Ages 6+

description: This stunning puzzle includes 73 bird species, both common and exotic, found in the coastal and wetland areas throughout the Gulf region, from Texas in the west, Louisiana, Alabama, and Florida Artist: Ernest Simmons Completed Size: 18" x 24

name: Shark Jacks
description: A classic game reborn from the deep blue sea! Bounce the ocean-blue ball, scoop up as many sharks as you can, and catch the ball with the same hand, letting the ball bounce only once. Can you do it?

name: Play Visions Sealife Origami
description: The Sealife Origami set offer hours of creative fun for kids to create their own 3D Origami creations. Origami is a fascinating and creative craft for kids. Not only will children get a real sense of satisfaction out of making these fun origami models, but they will be getting practice at following instructions, increasing their manual dexterity, and producing a fun, decorative and educational end-product.

•Watch the turtle bounce spin and wiggle as he skips on top of the water
•Comes in assorted colors

name: Play Visions Sea Life Slide Show
description: Use this mini projector to view all your favorite wild animals. Comes with 3 discs for a total of 24 images. Or use without the discs as a great little flashlight. Batteries included.

name: Safari Optic One Magnifier
description: 7-Functions: compass, monocular, binocular, signaling mirror, 2x and 4x magnifier and magnifying mirror. Available in Blue, Red, Green and Yellow

name: Play Visions Dizzy Dolphin Wheel-O's
description: The Dizzy Dolphin Wheel-O will give your child hours of fun. A classic toy fittingly updated in the unique CLUB EARTH style. Watch in amazement as Dizzy Dolphin whirls and twirls on it’s magnetic track. Recommended for ages 3 and up. (Blister Card)

name: Airshark Glider
description: The Club Earth name is well known in the toy industry. These toys are, playful, colorful, fun, and the packaging alone is sure to capture the interest of kids and parents alike. For example, Zillas-Large, colorful, stretchy frogs, worms, and caterpillars. Talknology is another example. These are cute animal pens with a new voice recording technology that mimics the rhythm of your voice during play back. Play Visions will continue to evolve Club Earth’s line, sticking with the basic concept of toys that are compelling, environmentally educational, and fun… Enjoy this Fun Air Shark. It's a bird…it's a plane…no, it's Air Shark, the glider with attitude. Soft and safe, with rubber band propulsion it flies over 50 feet.

name: Sandscape Motion Sculpture Large
description:
Self-Sculpting Sand A real desktop mesmerizer. This 7"x 5" moving sand sculpture creates endless sand-dune vistas, and can be so easily flipped to start over that you need never go back to actually working. The sand is so fine it's nearly liquid, and comes in varying shades, plus a little glitter. Black base and frame

name: Glass Coaster/Napkin Set
description: Serve your guests with one of these five fabulous assorted themed napkin and matching glass coaster sets, sure to be the talk of the party! Each set contains 4 - 3.75" square glass coasters and 20 - 5" packed in a window box.

name: ASST GLASS SEA TURTLE ORNAMENTS
description:
A great way to decorate the tree are with these four adorable baby sea turtles assorted to colors of green, orange, yellow and turquoise. Each glass turtle measures 2.5”L, comes in a gift box 

EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON 
SHIPPING.

name: IRRIDESCENT GLASS SANDDOLLAR
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING

Four beautiful irrridescent sand dollars come in blue, turquoise, green and clear glass. Each measures 3.5 in diameter

name: ASST PEARLIZED GLASS STARFISH
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING

Each glass starfish is 90 grams and comes in an assortment of clear, blue, green and purple with a beautiful pearlized finish.

name: GLASS SHELLS IN 4 ASST COLORS
description: Pretty, pearl like glass shells measure from 3.5 to almost 4 long and come in 4 colors

name: MULTI COLOR BLUE GLASS DOLPHIN
description: Reflecting turquoise and blues under clear glass, this beautiful one has an almost striped coloration swirled over his back. Hes approximately 4 x 6 across from nose to tail. All hand-made, color and design variations are the norm

name: Water Globe "Sea Turtle", "Dolphin" or "Sand Dollar"
description: EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING. Ocean themed water globe. Comes in three styles sold separately.  The "Sea Turtle" globe features two sea turtles swimming together over a coral reef. The "Dolphin" globe features two dolphins swimming together, and the "Sand Dollar" globe features a sand dollar, starfish and shell. The glass globe measures 65 millimeter filled with water and sparkling iridescent flakes making for a beautiful display piece. Globe and stand are approximately 3.75 inches tall and 2.5 inches wide. Sea turtles, dolphins, sand dollars and base are made from high quality resin.

name: GLASS BLUE/CLEAR SEA TURTLE PAPERWEIGHT
description: Each colorful turtle is 4.5 x 4.5 and looks as if he is swimming along the bottom of the sea! Each has a blue shell, clear fins and head and is boxed.

name: CRACKLED COLOR GLASS FISH BLUE AND GREEN
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING

Dont let these two fabulous tropical glass fish swim away! One adorned with assorted crackled colors of blue, creamy orange and red, the other with green, creamy orange and red. Each fish measure 6.50 x 5, approx. weighs 620 grams

name: GLASS SITTING PELICAN
description: With pretty assorted swirling colors, this precious glass pelican is to be a sure winner! Each measure 6 x 6, approx. weighs 780 grams and comes packed in a color photo box

name: GLASS BLUE/WHITE SEASHELL
description: The inside of this shell is rippled in blues and rimmed in gold. The outside is white with blue ripples covered in clear!

name: BROWN/WHT GLASS OCTOPUS FIGURE
description: A very pretty and unusual brown and white octopus is almost 8 across as he flexes his many arms for us

name: Small Glass Stingray
description: Striking glass figure for your home! Made of glass and colored gray, its tail is curved as it seems to swim along. This stingray figure is 5.5 X 5"

name: GLASS JELLYFISH CHIME
description:
Assorted glass jellyfish hang as decor or a windchine. each 10.5 inches 

EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING

name: GLASS DOUBLE DOLPHIN ON WAVE FIGURE
description: Pretty shades of white, blue and black glass make this shell a standout! Each 5.5" x 3.5"

name: GLASS BLUE OCTOPUS ON ROUND BALL PAPERWEIGHT
description: This glass octopus has spectacular swirls of ocean blue colors that really make this a wonderful piece! Each paperweight weighs approximately 950 grams, measures 3.5”H x 4.5”W,

name: BLUE GLASS JELLYFSH PAPERWEiGHT LARGE
description: Gorgeous hand blown glass jellyfish are encased in clear glass. Both are 6 x 3.5. The blue one matches the pink one of last year. The other is white and glows in the dark! Just beautiful

name: WOOD FLYING PELICAN
description: This Pelican is 11.5 x 20, very nicely painted to look life-like. A very different gift for a bird enthusiast!

name: WOOD FLYING SEA TURTLE
description: This cute fellow with spots of browns and blues is flapping his flippers in the air. Hangs 34”L from top to the bottom of the round white weight and has a flipper span of 23”W

name: Aquatic Playset: 12 Piece Toy set in Clip Bag for Play on the GO
description: Adventure Planet Aquatic 12 piece playset includes: green sea turtle, hammerhead shark, starfish, bottlenose dolphin, swordfish, greatwhite shark, lion seal, seahorse, emperor penguin, octopus, tiger shark and some duplicates. Figures measure from approximately 1 to 3 inches long and 1 to 2 inches tall. Set comes in a transparent vinyl bag with zipper and clip so you can easily bring your aquatic pals with you!

name: Safariology: Life Cycle of a Frog
description: The Incredible Creatures Collection features Extra large, soft, playful, true-to-life vinyl replicas of some of the most amazing creatures in the world. Excellent learning tool to introduce young children to our delicate and often endangered inhabitants of our planet. A fun way to spark the innate curiosity of a child. Each replica is finely hand painted and accurate down to the last detail

name: Safariology: Life Cycle of a Monarch Butterfly Model Kit
description: Discover the wondrous process of metamorphosis with this authentically sculpted and hand-painted set of figures. Each stage of development is shown, starting from the eggs, to the larva, to the chrysalis until the emergence of the colorful adult Monarch butterfly. Set is packaged on a peggable blister card with educational information (Blister card)

name: Safari Ltd. Life Cycle of a Green Sea Turtle
description:
•Exploring the stages of life
•All our products are phthalate-free and thoroughly safety tested to safeguard your child's health
•We take pride in the quality, innovation and design that have characterized our products for over 3 generations
•Discover the wondrous process of development with this life cycle set that includes four major stages in the lives of sea turtles
•Stages include sea turtle eggs, sea turtle hatchling, juvenile sea turtle and adult sea turtle
•Appropriate for ages 4+
•It includes educational information in three languages on each stage of development
•Packaged on a blister card

name: Miniature Plastic Toy Critter Assortments
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION CAREFULLY."SHARKS" (Option 1), "CORAL REEF" (Option 2), "OCEAN" (Option 3), "ON THE WATER" (Option 4), "WHALES AND DOLPHINS" (Option 5) 

Your child will have hours of fun with these colorful miniature ocean themed critters. The "Sharks" set includes various types of sharks and rays. The "Coral Reef" set includes an assortment of colorful coral reef creatures. The "Ocean" set includes whales, dolphins, sharks, octopus, seals and other marine creatures. The "On the Water" set includes various means of water travel such as boats and jet skis. The "Whales and Dolphins" set includes many types of whales and dolphins. 
   
EACH OPTION STATES WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING.  

Each piece measures approximately 2.5 inches in length and 3/4 inch wide. 

WARNING: These toys have small pieces and are not meant for children under 3 years of age.

name: Sea Turtles of the Americas (Weekend Naturalist © Field Guide, #4)
description: Sea Turtles of the Americas- WEEKEND NATURALIST field guide coalesce science, literature and vivid imagery to inspire a deeper connection with nature. A compilation of natural history Illustrations, poster, photos, maps & diagrams provide current and reliable information. Comprehensive text written by Jeffrey A. Seminoff Ph.D. Marine Turtle Ecology and Assessment Department, SW, NOAA. Natural history illustrations by Dawn N. Ericson & Dominique Navarro. The four page folded design (5.75" x 8.75) includes a 8.75" x 11.5 poster. Printed in the USA and laminated.

name: Seahorses and their Relatives (Weekend Naturalist © Field Guide, #3)
description: Seahorses and their Relatives - WEEKEND NATURALIST field guide coalesce science, literature and vivid imagery to inspire a deeper connection with nature. A compilation of natural history Illustrations, poster, photos, maps & diagrams provide current and reliable information. Condensed text is edited by Scientific Adviser Leslee Matsushige, Curator, Birch Aquarium at Scripps,UCSD, California. Natural history illustrations by Dawn N. Ericson & Dominique Navarro. The four page folded design (5.75" x 8.75) includes a 8.75" x 11.5 poster. Printed in the USA and laminated.

name: Backroads of Florida
description:
Away from the bustle of Miami Beach and the tourist extravaganza of Disney World, another Florida beckons to those looking for backroads adventure, quieter fare, or more discriminating fun. This is the Florida where backroads and secret splendors unfold in a landscape rich in the flavors and colors of ancient indigenous cultures, early European settlements, Civil War battles, and myriad Caribbean influences. Authors Paul Franklin and Nancy Mikula take you to every corner of the Sunshine State, from the Panhandle to the Florida Keys, with journeys along miles of spectacular coastline and forays into the wonders of lush interior forests, pristine lakes, and otherworldly swamplands.

 Florida is home to nearly a dozen national parks, forests, and seashores, and Backroads of Florida explores these attractions and many more, illustrated with breathtaking color photographs throughout. The book presents the background history and culture for Florida’s varied natural and human communities along with descriptions of the best destinations and sites to visit during your travels.

name: Birds of Florida
description: This little book has been very popular with Florida bird lovers for many years. It identifies 145 seashore, song and predatory birds. (paperback)

name: Florida Curiosities
description: The definitive collection of Florida's odd, wacky, and most offbeat people, places, and things, for Florida residents and anyone else who enjoys local humor and trivia with a twist. (paperback

name: Florida Parks A Guide to Camping and Nature
description:
ince 1981, Florida Parks has been recognized as the definitive guide to camping in Florida. 
This 6 by 9-inch book's 288 pages cover nearly 350 parks and camping areas on public lands in Florida--including
•state parks 
•state recreation areas 
•national parks 
•national forests 
•state forests 
•regional parks 
•county parks 
•preserves 
•wilderness areas 

and many other areas that offer either
•family camping, or 
•an outstanding natural area 

138 photographs give you a good sense of the range and variety of Florida's parks.

14 maps show you where the parks are located. Detailed directions accompany the description of each park.

There is an extensive 10-page index that makes it easy for you to find what you need. The index has special sections for locating parks with
•Archaeological sites 
•Bicycling 
•Birding 
•Cabins 
•Canoeing 
•Hiking 
•Historic sites 
•Horse camping 
•Horse trails 
•Living history enactments 
•Museums

name: Apalachicola Bay
description:
From the union of the Chattahoochee and Flint Rivers at the Georgia-Florida state line, the mighty Apalachicola River flows unimpeded for about 100 miles to the Gulf of Mexico. At the river’s mouth lies Apalachicola Bay and Florida’s "Forgotten Coast," known for world-class seafood and seemingly endless miles of pristine beaches, shallow estuaries, and protected forests. 
In Apalachicola Bay, author Kevin McCarthy takes us through the history of the bay’s sites and communities. Come along and discover

name: Florida's Living Beaches: A Guide for the Curious Beachcomber(hardcover)
description: Florida has 1200 miles of coastline, almost 700 miles of which are sancy beaches. Exploring along those beaches offers encounters with myriads of plants, animals, minerals, and manmade objects--all are covered in this comprehensive guide with descriptive accounts of 822 items, 983 color images, and 431 maps. Beginning with the premise that beaches are themselves alive, this guide to the natural history of Florida beaches heralds the living things and metaphorical life near, on, and within the state's sandy margins. It is organized into Beach Features, Beach Animals, Beach Plants, Beach Minerals, and Hand of Man. In addition to being an identification guide, the book reveals much of the wonder and mystery between dune and sea along Florida's long coastline.

name: Florida's Fabulous Seashells
description: Magazine Size Paperback with 112 pages. One of the Best Books ever published on Florida's Seashells. Fantastic Color Photographs. (paperback)

name: Florida's Fabulous Fishes
description: Very complete illustrations and information on Florida Fishes, highly recommended for those with special interests in knowing the wonders of Florida fishes, not only for the fishing sport but also for acquiring higher knowledge when buying in the fish markets.  (paperback)

name: Exploring Florida Gulf Coast Beaches
description: This is a guide to the best beaches on the west coast and southern tip of the state. Detailed information on beach access and amenities is accompanied by the history of each beach and other fascinating tidbits of information.

name: Waters Less Traveled
description:
Florida’s Big Bend Coast is one of America’s longest and wildest continuous wetlands. Seminole Indians once sought refuge from American soldiers along its shores. Today, visitors find a different kind of refuge, a refuge from a hectic world.

In the first comprehensive armchair guide to this region, naturalist and explorer Doug Alderson introduces readers to Florida’s frontier past and evolving future. Interweaving history, folkways, and observations from life in the great outdoors, Alderson tells tales of his travels by sea kayak along the Big Bend Saltwater Paddling Trail, which runs from the Aucilla River to the town of Suwannee. He retraces the footsteps of famed naturalist John Muir in Cedar Key, shares little-known stories of backcountry feuds that rivaled the Hatfields and McCoys, uncovers amusing theories as to why mullet jump, and invites salty local characters to share the spotlight. 

Sometimes poignant, often humorous, and always engaging, Waters Less Traveled is the perfect travel companion for anyone who wants a bit of adventure without leaving home. (paperback)

name: Seashore & Wading Birds
description: A handy-sized guide to over 110 species of waterside birds, the showiest in Florida. Every bird is pictured in color, with an accompanying description which details size, range, habitat, identifying characteristics and name origin. Truly an uncomplicated guide for a fascinating pastime of bird watching.(paperback)

name: Shark-Tastic  Ouch Real Shark teeth
description:
There may be a million shark books. But only one of them comes with real shark teeth!

This visually stunning celebration of kids’ favorite sea creature focuses on amazing facts and incredible pictures. Best of all, it comes with a pack of real shark’s teeth, which are housed in a blister pack and visible through a die-cut in the cover.

From the friendly, gigantic whale shark to the ravenous Great White, lively engaging text complements stunning photography in a winning and well-priced package

name: Sharkpedia
description: Learn where sharks lurk, what they eat, who they hang out with, and why the do what they do. Also, hear from scientists about why some sharks attack, and hear first-hand from survivors what an attack is like. Grab your bucket o' chum and climb aboard! (hardcover)

name: Little Finger Puppet Book
description:
EACH SOLD SEPARATELY. MAKE SURE TO SELECT YOUR OPTION BELOW CAREFULLY. EACH OPTION SHOWS WHICH PICTURE IT CORRESPONDS TO. BUY THE WHOLE SET AND SAVE ON SHIPPING

Kids will go crazy for these quirky books featuring lovable characters, bright and simple art, charming rhymed text, and best of all, adorable finger puppets! Each darling book has a permanently attached plush finger puppet and peek-a-boo holes in every page, presenting a super-fun way for parents and children to play and read together.

name: At the Beach (Dover Coloring Books)
description: Thirty large, ready-to-color pictures of a day at the seaside depict Mom and Dad packing the car, Sis chatting with a lifeguard, and more.

name: At the Aquarium (Dover Coloring Books
description: Twenty-nine large, easy-to-color images of marine life provide youngsters with visual tips for identifying animals and plants likely to be found at an aquarium. Shown in their natural habitats, they include, among others, a pair of kissing gourami, delightful seahorses, a dolphin, fiddler and horseshoe crabs, seals, and more. (paperback

name: Tropical Fish Coloring Book
description: Featuring intricate geometric designs and fabulous natural patterns to challenge coloring enthusiasts of all ages, each new book in this series includes 31 wonderful designs that are suitable for framing and use with crayons, felt-tipped pens, watercolors, colored pencils, or pastels. Just add some imagination to tap the creative power of the artist in you!.

name: Guess Who Ocean Friends
description: Five adorable ocean friends are waiting for kids to "guess who" in this fun and engaging book. Hidden behind "peekaboo" flaps, a turtle, sea lion, lobster, clownfish, and shark are just waiting to be discovered. Inviting rhymes offer simple clues to help readers guess who's hiding. A special surprise under each flap and big pop-up at the end add to the charm of this delightful book (hardcover)

name: Jenny Jellyfish A tale of Wiggly Jellies
description: Amazing facts about moon jellies, animals with no heart, bones or brain.(paperback)

name: Teena Tortoise A Tale of a Little Giant
description: Captivating natural history facts about the Galapagos Islands, featuring giant tortoises and other unique species found there. (paperback)

name: Skippy Scallop: A Tale of Bright Blue Eyes
description: The interesting story of an animal that survives because of its many blue eyes. (paperback)

name: Perky Pelican A Tale of a Lively Bird
description: Story and facts from Suzanne's exciting research at a pelican rookery. (paperback)

name: Katie K. Whale A Whale of a Tale
description: A tale based on the true story of a killer whale. Winner of a Children's Choice Award from the International Reading Association and Children's Book Council. (paperback)

name: Rosie Ray A Tale of Watery Wings
description: Many facts about the spotted eagle ray, an elegant creature that leaps from the water and soars like an eagle. (paperback)

name: Oopsie Otter A tale of Playful Otters
Johnny Longlegs A Tale of Big Birds
description: A beautifully illustrated book about a great blue heron that surprisingly meets a flamingo. Based on a true story.

name: Little Lizzie Aligator  A Tale of a Big Lizard
description: Interesting family behavior of the American alligator. Winner of a Children's Choice Award (paperback)

name: Happy Hermit Crab A Tale of Shell Seekers
description: Interesting natural history facts about hermit crabs and why they must seek the safety of shells.

name: Great Sharky Shark A tale ofa Big Hunter
description: Fascinating shark facts with lessons about the impact humans have on sea life and the environment. (paperback)

name: Flossie Flounder A tale of Flat Fish
description: A tale developed around the interesting fact that a baby flounder looks different from its parents. (paperback)

name: Ellie & Otter Eel A Tale of a Fantastic Voyage
description: A book about the incredible life cycle of eels, telling how they return to the bays and rivers of their birth. (paperback)

name: Davy Sand dollar A Tale of a Spiny Animal
description: Unusual facts about sand dollars that will educate adults as well as children. (paperback)

name: Crabby & Nabby A Tale of Two Blue Crabs
description: All about blue crabs and their life cycle from the viewpoint of two colorful, crabby characters, Crabby and Nabby. (paperback)

name: Spunky Spot  A Tale of One Smart Fish
description: A young fish learns from his teacher to "just say no" to worms so he won't get hooked! This book has approval of Just Say No International (paperback)

name: Stevie B. Sea Horse a Tale of a Proud Papa
description: Fascinating facts about an unusual fish that reverses parental roles. Papa sea horse nurtures the eggs! (paperback)

name: Spiny Sea Star A Tale of Seeing Stars
description: All about a spiny-skinned animal, known also as a starfish, that is a marvel of nature. (paperback)

name: Crabby Swims Free A Tale of a Close Call
description: Crabby and Nabby are back with a thrilling new adventure. Crabby gets caught but a little girl sets him free! (paperback)

name: Pearlite Oyster A Tale of an Amazing Oyster
description: A story about the amazing life if an oyster and how a pearl is formed.

name: Sammy Shrimp a Tale of a Little Shrimp
description: Exciting tale of a little shrimp and his big sister. Facts about shrimp in simple and entertaining format. (paperback)

name: Salty Seagull A Tale of an Old Salt
description: A tale of an old bird whose wise ways save his flock. This charming story teaches children respect of elders (paperback)

name: Danny & Daisy A Tale of a Dolphin Duo
description: Helpful humans rescue two young dolphins and take them to a science center for rehabilitation. (paperback)

name: Charlie Clownfish and Annie A.
description: A fascinating story of the symbiotic relationship between clownfish and sea anemones. Young children will identify with the need to have best friends.  (paperback)

name: Crabby's Water Wish
description:
Clean Water Charlie teaches children how they can help to improve water quality. Sponsored by NC Assoc. of Soil & Water Conservation Districts.
(paperback)

name: Billy Bluefish, A Tale of Big Blues (Suzanne Tate's Nature Series)
description: A tale about the trials and lessons learned by a young bluefish that finds it doesn't pay to be a bully (paperback)

name: How to Hide an Octopus
description: With stunning, full-color illustrations of sea creatures, and an informative, rhyming text, Heller leads young ones on a search for a giant red sea dragon, a huge crab, and several exotic fish as she explores the secrets of camouflage in the ocean depths. A Reading Rainbow Review Title.

name: The Great Manatee Rescue
description: Join Ali on the adventure of a lifetime! When Ali moves from the mountains to the coast, she has a tough time adjusting to a new town and a new school. That is until she meets some unique inhabitants of her new neighborhood--a mother manatee and her baby! Ali finds a "secret place"... a nearby canal that is home to these very special animals. Ali spends hours at her "secret place" observing the manatees. With the help of her friend, Einstein, and her teacher, Mrs. Fields, Ali learns all about manatees. Then one day something terrible happens to shatter Ali's secret world! Find out how Ali uses her knowledge about manatees to save the day. Learn all about the gentle manatees and efforts to save this endangered animal in this action-packed adventure!

name: A Sea Turtles Story
description: Plunge into the exciting world of sea turtles! Join Pancake, a loggerhead sea turtle on an amazing adventure. One day, Pancake is injured by a boat. The sea turtle is rescued and taken to a very special place - a hospital just for sea turtles! Working at the hospital is a young girl named Lolly. Lolly helps take care of the injured turtle. The girl and the sea turtle form a special bond. With Lolly's help, Pancake gets better. In time the loggerhead turtle is released back to the sea. But, Lolly never forgets Pancake. Miraculously, Pancake and Lolly meet again! Pancake has come back to the beach to nest. Once more, Lolly is there to help. But this time its not Pancake that needs helps - it's her babies! Find out how Lolly helps save the sea turtles! Learn about sea turtles in this action-packed book. (Includes a special educational section filled with fascinating facts and web sites for children.) Also, you'll meet the "real" Lolly and hear her true story...

name: I Wonder Why The Sea Is Salty
description: Insatiable young oceanographers will discover amazing facts in this compendium of marine questions and answers. (paperback)

name: Sam the Sea Cow
description:
Sam is called a sea cow because that's what he looks like - a big cow grazing in the ocean. Another name for Sam is manatee. In this book we meet Sam when he is just hours old and leave him when he is ready to mate. In between is a great deal of information about manatees mixed in with a big adventure for Sam. 



An exciting, fact-filled book gorgeously illustrated in full color.

name: Seashells, Crabs and Sea Stars: Take-Along Guide
description: An introduction to the world of seashells, crabs, and sea stars including identification information, educational activities, and fun facts. Invites young naturalists to spot wildlife. Safety tips are provided and interesting activities are suggested.

name: A Swim through the Sea
description: Praised by Jacques Cousteau, this book, illustrated and written by a16 year-old, is a classic introduction to the marine habitat. This 1994 alphabet and alliteration book continues to be a favorite of kids, parents, and teachers everywhere. It is truly an exceptional swim through an alphabet of sea creatures. Each page highlights a selected species with a full-color illustration and a paragraph of fascinating facts, surrounded by a frame full of extra creatures and vocabulary. It reaches a large age range because the large text is for young readers, while smaller text is for you or more advanced children. Kristin Joy Pratt (A Walk in the Rainforest) once again successfully inspires a generation of children about one of the most precious and fragile realms on Earth. A 48-page teachers guide (sold separately) is a valuable educator companion.

name: Good Night Beach Childrens Book
description: The beach, an iconic fixture of many children’s summers, is artfully celebrated in this boardbook. Designed to soothe children before bedtime while instilling an early appreciation for the environment’s natural wonders, the book features a multicultural group of people experiencing all that the beach has to offer. Rhythmic language guides children through the passage of a single day of fun at the seaside—splashing, playing in the waves, boating, fishing, identifying wildlife, and more.

name: Good Night Ocean Childrens Book
description: An educational and enriching book set in the diverse environments of the world’s oceans, this delightful story will soothe young children before bedtime while fostering an appreciation for the beauty and diversity of the marine world. Celebrating the wonders of the undersea world, this voyage takes place through the passage of both one day and the four seasons of the year while a family greets a wide range of marine life, including whales, clownfish, crabs, shrimp, eels, octopus, penguins, swordfish, seals, and sharks. Traveling by sailboat, fishing boat, battleship, and submarine, children will learn about all of the world’s major oceans as well as beaches, islands, reefs, harbors, bays, and icebergs.

name: Pocket Genius: Sharks
description:
Destined to be toted in school backpacks everywhere, this new encyclopedia series for young readers contains on-the-spot information in children's favorite subject areas. Kids love facts: they want to know about the biggest, fastest, tallest, and oldest everything. Full of instant information, these books feature a fresh design that is sure to appeal to the middle grade audience. These single-subject guides offer a unique catalog-style presentation, which clearly lays out individual subcategories with concise and punchy text covering all of the essential information on whatever topic is at-hand.

Pocket Genius: Sharks profiles more that 150 sharks and rays — from the great white to the tiny dwarf lantern — and tells what they eat, where they live and how fast they swim.

Supports the Common Core State Standards

name: Sea Turtle Hatching Childrens Book
description: This book takes readers inside the mysterious world of Loggerhead sea turtles as they hatch in their nest and head out toward the open sea. One little sea turtle goes the wrong way and is rescued by a young boy, who learns about the dangers and adventures encountered by sea turtles everywhere. Sea Turtles Hatching is bound to delight and educate readers of all ages!

name: Dolphins (Our Wild World)
description: Where the animal lives, what it eats, when it sleeps, how it raises its young and much more.— Over 30 vivid, full color photos and illustration.— Sidebar Fun Facts, an index and a list of Internet Sites (paperback

name: Sharks Our Wild world
description: Every title contains: -Where the animal lives, what it eats, when it sleeps, how it raises its young, and much more. -Over 30 vivid, full color photos and illustrations. -Sidebar 'Fun Facts,' an index and a list of useful Internet Sites.

name: Sea Turtles (Our Wild World)
description: Sea turtles live in all the oceans of the world, with five species found near the United States. This Our Wild World book provides the latest information on sea turtles in an easy-to-read format, featuring 22 up-close photos and detailed illustrations.

name: Sea Life Games & Puzzles
description:
We call it Earth but our planet might have been more aptly named Ocean. After all, nearly seventy percent of it is covered with saltwater, forming a great frontier that’s home to all sorts of awesome species. Sea Life Games & Puzzles invites kids to learn more about their favorite sea creatures and ocean phenomena as they work their way through puzzles, games, brainteasers, and jokes. 

 Kids will have hours of fun as they lead a clownfish through a coral maze, determine which oyster is hiding the pearl, and figure out ocean creatures are called lemons (sharks), cows (manatees), and barbers (fish). Throughout the voyage, children will also rub elbows—oops, make that fins!—with a famous dolphin and a few other marine celebrities. All in all, it’s a guaranteed whale of a good time—and that’s no fish story!

name: Best Beach Games
description: Here are 77 simple, engaging games you and your family can play on the shore. Most require nothing more than items found naturally on the beach. (paperback)

name: Awesome Ocean Science (Williamson Kids Can! Series)
description: Kids will love this irresistible learning playground filled with skill-building and a hands-on way of learning science. A Parents' Choice Silver Honor Award winner, this title is in full-color throughout offering boatloads of cool science facts about our underwater world (paperback)

name: Busy Bumble Bee Rides the Waves (hardcover)
description: A little bumble bee rides a piece of driftwood far from his home on the Isle of St. James at St. Teresa Beach, Florida, then must ask creatures of the Gulf of Mexico to help him return. Includes facts about a variety of animals, as well as the geographic areas featured.

name: GSML Cloth Patch
description: Cloth Sew on patch with turtle design.

name: Blue Turtle T-Shirt Youth
description: Blue Sea Turtle T-Shirt with 9 hidden turtles. Gildan T-Shirt Made exclusively with cotton grown in the USA

name: Extinct Is Forever T-Shirt -Cream
description:
T-shirt with an image of a sea turtle on back reminding everyone to do their part.

"Do your part to save these wonderful, ancient creatures, because Extinct is Forever! All seven species of sea turtle are endangered due to habitat destruction and pollution."

name: Gulf Specimen Marine Lab T-Shirt
description: A white t-shirt featuring colorful marine life, all of which can be found at the Gulf Specimen Marine Lab!

name: Book : Potluck
description:
Preston Barfield is an upstanding small-family commercial fisherman whose vanishing way of life on the Gulf Coast of Florida pressures him into accepting an offer he can't refuse. When Preston gets a panicked call from his brother-in-law Lupino that his boat is on fire, he turns his shrimp trawler offshore to the rescue, only to find Lupino's burning boat filled with smugglers and marijuana. Hard times and desperation force his hand into adventures he never imagined. 

The "Forgotten Coast" is forgotten no longer in this riveting novel of plain folks on the edge. A major inside story of this culturally rich area is finally told.

name: Butterflies on a Sea Wind: Beginning Zen
description: Anne Rudloe was attracted to Zen as a college student. But it seemed premature for a 21-year-old to focus on the difficulties of life when she'd hardly begun to live. Twenty-five years later, she was ready to explore the spiritual discipline that originated in Asian monasteries more than a millennium ago. Rudloe's quest is compellingly chronicled in Butterflies on a Sea Wind, which combines the rigor of formal monastic Zen practice with the challenges of integrating Zen concepts into modern daily life. Her narrative describes both the physical and mental demands of Zen retreats and how she applied what she learned there to her work as a marine biologist in Florida, as well as to the rigors of raising children and caring for an elderly grandmother. In words that intimately draw in her readers, she describes how Zen helps us look inward and use the wisdom we find there to reach out to others. Buddhism is one of the fastest growing spiritual traditions in America today. During the 1990s, the number of organized Buddhist centers in this country grew more than 40 percent, from 429 to 1,062. While there are many books about Zen on the market today, few give a clear picture of what it's like to actually sit down and begin a meditation practice and then apply it to a daily life. Likewise, few books discuss the types of issues most people face every day: raising a family and earning a living. Butterflies on a Sea Wind does all this and more

name: Priceless Florida: Natural Ecosystems and Native Species
description:
Priceless Florida presents the incomparable ecological riches of this unique region in a way that will appeal to young and old, laypersons and scientists. A cornucopia of colorful illustrations and exquisite photos makes you feel you’re there. The comprehensive text enlightens with facts and brims with intriguing curiosities while bridging multiple fields in a crisp, readable style that only seasoned science-educators like Drs. Whitney, Means, and Rudloe could offer. 
The authors enlighten us on every kind of natural area found within the Sunshine State. Imagine yourself trekking into a hammock, slogging through a swamp, floating down a river, strolling along a beach, hovering over a coral reef, or probing the depths of an underwater cave. You’ll discover how everything from soils, rocks, water, and landforms shape flora and fauna—and vice versa. You’ll also learn how the survival of some of the world’s most endangered species and ecosystems hinges on our actions. Much of Florida has been bought and sold many times over, but this book makes clear how its value truly has no pricetag.

name: Book : Zen in a Wild Country: Solo Wilderness Meditation
description: Marine biologist and Zen teacher Anne Rudloe explores the spiritual value of being alone in wilderness settings. Out of that comes this nature based meditation on life, death, and meaning that draws upon the insights of science and religion, marine biology and Zen. Having taught marine ecology to university students for years, she now adds to the science a more experiential and meditational relationship with the sea grass meadows, long leaf pine forests and cypress lakes of the Florida wilderness which is the book?s primary setting. Vivid narrative adventure sections include several encounters with alligators, a midnight meeting with a bear, a rescue at sea, a struggle with scuba gear over rocks in breaking seas, a helicopter based eagle survey, and chasing sea turtles in the Everglades. Anne?s years of scientific research on marine animals, including electric rays, horseshoe crabs and bryozoans, takes on new and unexpectedly personal meanings. A 90 day traditional Zen retreat, with approximately equal proportions of beauty and grueling struggle, becomes a turning point in the journey, but the primary teachers remain the forest and sea throughout the narrative. Although she uses predominately Zen spiritual methods, the story is inclusive and relevant to those of other faiths or of no faith at all who find themselves in a time of personal seeking. Like her previous book, Butterflies on a Sea Wind: Beginning Zen, the story is told in an engaging style aimed at a non expert. The book provides a brief but fascinating review of the latest scientific research on consciousness as it explores what science can add to ancient religious methods for facing the Big Questions. The book is a contribution to the current dialogues between science and religion.

name: Book : Chicken Wars
description: Superchicken, Augustus Herkissing (formerly, in a previous life - Henry Kissinger) the champion of chickens everywhere, has been sent to our present day world via a heavenly council. He has been sent to earth to free the chickens and lead them to the Promised Land.

name: Book : Search for the Great Turtle Mother
description: Science, mythology, and conservation ethics are interwoven in this captivating and highly personal travelogue. It recounts how Jack Rudloe's lifelong fascination with sea turtles led him to journey to Central America and Malaysia to investigate the theory that magnetic forces help guide sea turtles in their migration, and to explore the Turtle Mother legend that shaped the attitudes of other, more primitive cultures. These ancient myths fostered a deep respect for sea turtles that helped to assure their sustainable harvest, in contrast with the ruinous practices of today.

name: Book : The Wilderness Coast
description: The true adventures of a marine naturalist stalking the shorelines and shallows of Northwest Florida for swordfish, crocodiles, strange toad-fish and giant sea roaches.

name: Book : The Living Dock
description: Jack Rudloe tells about his adventures and misadventures as a professional marine specimen collector-- and about the barnacle-encrusted dock which intimately connects him with the teeming sea life of the bay, the mud flats, the grass-beds and marshlands of the Florida Gulf Coast.

name: Book : Shrimp : The Endless Quest for Pink Gold
description:
This book is a book about shrimp. It's about people who love to eat shrimp, fishermen who roam the seas catching them, and aquaculturists who raise them in ponds, selling them more cheaply than fishermen ever could. 

This book is about shrimp, but it's also about the past and future and about a conflict as old as humanity itself--the conflict between hunters-gatherers and farmers.

This book is about shrimp, but it is also about the vastness and diversity of nature and humanity. You will meet shrimp powerful enough to break aquarium glass. You will travel in time, from abandoned Mayan tombs to the California Gold Rush; in space, from the heart of Cajun country to the English Channel; in environments, from battered trawlers to university laboratories.

You will learn things you never imagined-- about microbiology and real estate and about economics and ecosystems. As you meet the people around the world who've caught, sold, cooked, and loved shrimp, you might just meet your own ancestors.
